reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in B1 bungalow which was the first bungalow on the left. Thought it was going to be noisy being closest to st & parking area but we had 4 long sleep ins...the longest on our travels in 2 months. 2 reasons - dark rooms and quiet. Very clean, spacious, v reliable wifi and all the comforts you need. Pool was lovely...novel stools in the water. The ladies in reception were always lovely and 2 staff in particular spoke excellent english. Reception assisted with a driver for the day to some tourist spots. Called for tuktuks whenever we needed which almost always seemed to be 100 baht. An easy walk if up for the 20 mins to night bazaar / bus station.
reviews.title: Clean and quiet

reviews.text: Would recommend it as a nice stay in CR.
reviews.title: A little Oasis in Chiang Rai....

reviews.text: Now the minor negatives - 1) bathroom floods entirely when showering 2) during breakfast milk should be on ice as it was warm everyday & hot food to be kept hot (fried eggs stone cold/red curry cold) 3) English speaking channels on the TV??
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: We recently stayed at Baan Soontree, Chiang Rai with our family of four. Our stay was only for one night, but we wished it was for longer. The hotel is just lovely and has a relaxed and very Thai atmosphere about it. The rooms are a combination of small one and two level separate bungalows. They do have a family room, but it only has bedding for three people. For our family of four people we booked two rooms side by side. These were not adjoining because they are free standing. The rooms were very clean and quite spacious. They have a large bathroom and adjoining bathroom area with a large fridge and a bench. They also include drying racks in this area.
reviews.title: can't say enough about the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds were comfortable - firm but not rock hard.
reviews.title: Very nice and quiet

reviews.text: This is a wonderful place to stay: clean, quiet, comfortable and very spacious. The staff is extremely helpful and welcoming. Rooms are huge, beds are comfortable, everything looks new and the hotel is well maintained. The pool and the jacuzzi are also great to unwind and relax.
reviews.title: A little nest of paradise, great place!

reviews.text: The hotel is a little bit far from the city centre but you can get a blue tuktuk for 50BHT (you have to ask reception for the blue ones, or they will get you on the regular ones for 60-80BHT).
reviews.title: Great place, spacious rooms.

reviews.text: The hotel offers laundry (pay per piece) and there is free wifi in rooms. We had trouble logging in from our mobile devices and they got it fixed during the day which was a lovely attention - we had forgotten about it and were not too fussed but it was great to feel they were doing everything they could to make our stay enjoyable.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: My two suggested paths to improvement are quite minor: there was no safe in the room which was surprising given the type of hotel and the although the breakfast was nice, there was not as much variety as we have seen in other hotels in the same price range.
reviews.title: Delightful and a fifteen minute walk from dowtown Chiang Rai

reviews.text: This hotel is a bit outside the centre of Chiang Rai but nicely calm and clean, with generously sized suites, good beds with mosquito netting, tea making facilities and well working showers. Only one member of staff seemed to speak some English, but we had no problems communicating our needs and questions. Wifi was free.
reviews.title: Good value, nice Thai hotel

reviews.text: We did not use the swimming pool as it was raining, but enjoyed the buffet breakfast in the main house. Room service was fast and very welcome on our first day when we arrived tired and wet. Good value hotel, though probably would not stay for more than 3-4 nights.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for 4 nights I booked through Agoda and got a great rate. I had a bungalow the bedroom was huge, the bed was very comfortable it had a separate room which had chairs a bench, kettle and fridge. The bathroom was lovely and had a great rain shower which was fantastic. Had a nice size Television with a couple of English Channels. Had great free Wifi and a lovely porch to sit out on and was spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Lovely, quiet setting
Great accommodation shame about the location
reviews.text: Checking in was easy the girls spoke a little English. It has a lovely pool and free breakfast which was ok you have this overlooking the pool. There was a fitness centre there that had a bike a stepper plus other excercise equipment. I had a couple of meals there which we're really nice. It was very quiet and any time I needed to go anywhere reception would call a tuk tuk which cost 80 baht no matter where I went. It was only about 10 mins from the action. I would stay here again and I recommend this place.

This is the second year we have stayed here and even though it is a short tuk-tuk ride into the center of town, we feel it is worth it. You can find the basics of Tesco, 7/11 and a few hawkers about a 10 minute walk away if you haven't eaten or picked up what you need in the town center. It is very clean, with complimentary water, kettle, coffee powder, tea, basic breakfast, lovely pool and friendly, helpful staff. There is a little outdoor porch where you can sit or an indoor lanai, depending on your choice. The resort is in its own little compound that has a sliding gate for overnight. Staff will phone for transportation for you and let you know the cost ahead of time. We feel that the place is a little oasis of peace and quiet. We would highly recommend it just as it was recommended to us by others we met during our travels last year.
reviews.title: Great staff in Baan soontree Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Baan Soontree based on other reviews on Trip Advisor. It has turned out to be even better than we expected. The rooms are clean - we are in a basic double, apparently the higher priced suites are huge and fabulous but we are very content, the bedroom and bathroom are more than adequate, the rain shower is good and with plenty of hot water and we have a fridge for our beer! The pool is clean and inviting though a bit cold - mostly we are enjoying the ambiance, it is a cosy and friendly environment and we have met a number of our fellow travellers. Staff are very helpful, breakfast is ok. The "resort" is situated on a quiet alley off a main road, about 7 to 10 minutes on a bicycle from the centre of Chiang Rai. We booked on AGODA and got a great deal.
reviews.title: Peaceful and friendly

reviews.text: This is a great hotel with really nice clean rooms. The rooms are very tastefully fitted out, Lanna style. Showers a bit slow to warm up, and a bit of a challenge to keep regulated - but not too unusual for Thailand.... The staff are really helpful. It's a short tuk-tuk ride to the centre of town - 50 to 80 baht. The pool area is compact and Breakfast is adequate. Overall great value and highly recommended. Next time in Chaing Rai this will be first choice.
reviews.title: Charming hotel, good location, great staff

reviews.text: We booked 2 days and stayed 5. Wonderful, considerate staff who put in that little bit more. Close enough to walk 15imutes to food and shops or 80-100 baht by tuktuk. Yes, we would stay again.
reviews.title: Tucked away, quiet but only 10 minutes away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is something of a curate's egg and is "good in parts".
reviews.title: Some good points, but......

reviews.text: The hotel is small and occupies a long, narrow site with the rooms, set out resort style as individual two storey bungalows, on two sides with the gym / breakfast area taking up the third. The pool is on this third side and is a plunge pool with a small jacuzzi at one end and not a lap pool for proper swimming.
reviews.title: in an out of the way neighborhood
